doc.after: Bilingual road signs street names business and advertisement signage in both Gaelic and English are gradually being introduced throughout Gaelic speaking regions in the Highlands and Islands including Argyll In many cases this has simply meant re adopting the traditional spelling of a name such as R tagan or Loch Ailleart rather than the anglicised forms Ratagan or Lochailort respectively
